item.title: Fiber Optic Leased Lines for Business
Fiber Buildings Offer High Bandwidth
item.description: Do you want to upgrade your internet speed from slow copper or fixed wireless connections to the rapid speeds offered by fiber optic cables? Are you trying to avoid the high cost of installing new fiber optic cables? If so, you should consider moving into a fiber building. Don’t worry; a fiber building isn’t constructed from exotic materials like carbon fiber. The term “fiber” refers to the type of telecommunication services already available within the building.

item.title: SONET Rings To Support Ethernet
item.description: The popular choice for bandwidth right now is Carrier Ethernet, mainly because it’s much cheaper than traditional WAN connections. This affordability makes it highly desirable. The main concern for most is availability. In many cases, Carrier Ethernet is accessible for a couple of key reasons. Firstly, emerging competitors are quickly building their fiber optic networks with IP as the foundation, which is perfect for Carrier Ethernet. This makes it straightforward to connect distant business locations with a point-to-point Ethernet connection, essentially merging their LANs into a single, larger network.

item.description: Large organizations with high bandwidth needs, such as financial institutions and research labs, often require more capacity than standard telecom services offer. item.title: Fiber Optic Private Lines
item.description: Businesses seeking private line bandwidth exceeding 50 Mbps often find that copper-based options are inadequate. While high-bandwidth wireless solutions might be available in select urban areas, fiber optic services typically become necessary to meet such demands. A prevalent fiber optic solution for metro and long-distance networks is SONET/SDH (Synchronous Optical NETwork/Synchronous Digital Hierarchy). This technology utilizes a highly synchronized time-division multiplexing (TDM) protocol, offering minimal latency and diverse bandwidth options reaching 40 Gbps and beyond.

item.title: Same Budget, More Bandwidth
item.description: By: John Shepler Is Slow Network Speed Affecting Your Business? Are you experiencing frustrating network issues like slow downloads, choppy calls, interrupted streaming, and sluggish website loading? Do You Need More Bandwidth? There’s a good chance your internet connection needs more bandwidth. While your internal network might be fast enough, your external connection (WAN) might not be able to handle your current needs. Signs You Need More Bandwidth If your internet service hasn’t changed in years but your business relies more on multimedia and online tools, you probably need more bandwidth.
